title: How Northern Europe is readying for war with Russia: A Le Monde documentary
summary: 'The Russian trap.' In the shadow of the war in Ukraine, an invisible frontline has been taking shape in Europe. From Estonia to Norway, Le Monde met with military officers to investigate this hybrid war, already a reality on Europe's northern borders.

title: Putin will have to 'come to table,' British PM Starmer says, hosting coalition call
summary: Keir Starmer hosted a call with some 25 leaders of allied nations in the 'coalition of the willing' seeking to help enforce a potential truce between Russia and Ukraine.

title: Trump says US struck Houthi rebels, who report at least 15 killed
summary: The Houthis reported a series of explosions in their territory Saturday evening. Images circulating online showed plumes of black smoke over the area of the Sanaa airport complex, which includes a sprawling military facility.

title: France demolishes Scotland 35-16 to win Six Nations title
summary: Fullback Thomas Ramos scored 20 of the winning points for France on Saturday in Paris.

title: Trump freezes US-funded media outlets: 'Goodbye,' White House says
summary: Kari Lake, a firebrand Trump supporter and former Arizona news anchor put in charge of the media agency after she lost a US Senate bid, said in an email to the outlets that federal grant money 'no longer effectuates agency priorities.' White House press official Harrison Fields took a more casual tone, simply writing 'goodbye' on X in 20 languages, a jab at the outlets' multilingual coverage.

title: 'Peaky Blinders' in Paris, a poorly executed stage adaptation
summary: This dance-theater adaptation of the hit series, presented with live music at La Seine Musicale in Boulogne-Billancourt west of Paris, is a disappointment.

title: At least 27 dead as tornadoes ravage central US
summary: Governor Sarah Huckabee Sanders declared a state of emergency in response and said she had spoken with President Donald Trump. Roofs were torn off homes and large trucks overturned, as forecasters warned of more tornadoes to come this weekend.

title: 'France's deterrent must be part of a future multi-layered European protection system'
summary: The extension of France's nuclear doctrine to neighboring countries presupposes an overall strategic redefinition of European defense, not forgetting conventional weapons, writes Louis Gautier, former secretary general of defense and national security, in an article for Le Monde.

title: In Poland, the far right on the offensive two months ahead of the presidential election
summary: Slawomir Mentzen, the far-right Konfederacja alliance candidate, is credited with 22% of voting intentions in the Polish presidential election on May 18.

title: Jacques Villeneuve: 'Ferrari and Lewis Hamilton are a dream pairing in F1. If he wins, it would be great!'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the 1997 world champion says that the 2025 Formula 1 season, which kicks off on Sunday with the Australian Grand Prix, could see the return of the Scuderia and McLaren to the top, to the detriment of Red Bull.

title: Trump signs bill funding US government for six months, avoiding a shutdown
summary: The bill largely keeps government funding at levels set during Joe Biden's presidency, though with changes. It trims non-defense spending by about $13 billion from the previous year and increases defense spending by about $6 billion.

title: Trump declares war on Columbia University, American bastion of progressivism
summary: The American president is determined to bring the New York institution to heel by cutting $400 million in grants, calling academic freedom into question and arresting students involved in pro-Palestinian protests.

title: Tens of thousands converge in Serbia's capital for protest against corruption
summary: Police said over 100,000 people were present at a protest against President Aleksandar Vucic and his government, in what was expected to be the largest demonstration in the movement that started four months ago.

title: NGOs contest Beauvais airport expansion, citing France's climate commitments
summary: Three NGOs are taking legal action against the new airport infrastructure concession contract, arguing that it is contrary to the 2015 Paris Agreement.

title: Rodrigo Duterte, former Philippines president, appears before ICC's judges
summary: Following his extradition by Manila, the former leader appeared before the International Criminal Court on Friday, charged with possible crimes against humanity committed as part of his war on drugs.

title: US expels South African ambassador, saying he 'hates' Trump
summary: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio described Ambassador Ebrahim Rasool, a former anti-apartheid campaigner, as 'a race-baiting politician who hates America and hates' Trump.

title: Olivier Nduhungirehe, Rwandan foreign minister: 'We have no soldiers on Congolese soil'
summary: With Kigali accused of providing military support to the M23 rebels in the east of the DRC, and negotiations between the DRC and the M23 due to open on Tuesday, the Rwandan foreign minister spoke to Le Monde.

title: France wary of Scotland spoiling Six Nations party
summary: The French men's rugby team hosts Scotland at the Stade de France on Saturday to conclude the tournament. While a bonus-point win would guarantee them the title, Les Bleus remain vigilant.

title: Geneva's International Red Cross Museum threatened with closure
summary: The Swiss Confederation's budget cuts are worrying the institution, which has lost a quarter of its funding.

title: Manor house, gold bars and fascist memorabilia: Jean-Marie Le Pen's murky heritage
summary: The co-founder of the far-right Front National party, who died on January 7, had, in life, become a repulsive figure in his own camp. After his death, many on the far right unreservedly embraced his political legacy. But the man also left behind a mysterious fortune.

title: Maria Mazzotta's punk-rock tarantellas
summary: The Italian singer with a powerful voice brings her second solo album, 'Onde,' to the French stage.

title: The French beauty products industry fears Washington's wrath
summary: In response to the trade war started by Donald Trump, the European Union is considering taxing make-up products and essential oils from the US. The European cosmetics industry therefore fears it will be targeted by the US president in retaliation.
